eu.webtoolkit.jwt
Class WStackedWidget

java.lang.Object
  eu.webtoolkit.jwt.WObject
      eu.webtoolkit.jwt.WWidget
          eu.webtoolkit.jwt.WWebWidget
              eu.webtoolkit.jwt.WInteractWidget
                  eu.webtoolkit.jwt.WContainerWidget
                      eu.webtoolkit.jwt.WStackedWidget

public class WStackedWidget
extends WContainerWidget

A container widget that stacks its widgets on top of each other

This is a container widgets which at all times has only one item visible. The widget accomplishes this using WWebWidget.setHidden(boolean hidden) on the children.

Using getCurrentIndex() and setCurrentIndex(int index) you can retrieve or set the visible widget.

WStackedWidget, like WContainerWidget, is by default not inline.

See Also:
WMenu

Method Detail

addWidget

public void addWidget(WWidget widget)
Description copied from class: WContainerWidget
Add a child widget to this container.

This is equivalent to passing this container as the parent when constructing the child. The widget is appended to the list of children, and thus also layed-out at the end.

Overrides:
addWidget in class WContainerWidget

setCurrentIndex

public void setCurrentIndex(int index)
Shows a particular widget.

The widget with index index is made visible, while all other widgets are invisible.

See Also:
getCurrentIndex(), setCurrentWidget(WWidget widget)

setCurrentWidget

public void setCurrentWidget(WWidget widget)
Shows a particular widget.

The widget widget, which must have been added before, is made visible, while all other widgets are invisible.

See Also:
getCurrentWidget(), setCurrentIndex(int index)
